results.title: The Invisible disability: hearing impairment
results.creator_credit: Alan Foley, Des Pickering and Burwood State College Special Education Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria College Special Education Films”.
Hearing impairment is a common disability amongst the community and this documentary aims to make people more aware of this disability. The causes of deafness are discussed and the program stresses the importance of early detection, as language and speech development are seriously affected if help is delayed. Children and parents discuss their problems with communication. Narrated by Barry McQueen.

results.title: Carronbank: Deaf Blind Education
results.creator_credit: Francis Treacey, Victoria College (Melbourne, Vic.) and Des Pickering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Victoria College Special Education Films”.
A documentary that looks at the education of children with visual and hearing impairment. A very important early stage of education is to teach the children how to communicate and the teachers at Carronbank discuss how this is done. The curriculums, at Carronbank, cater for all needs, including social skills as well as the educational requirements.

results.title: Victoria's favourite things
results.brief_description:
Check out what people brought to ACMI for July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’.
Recorded live in ACMI’s Screen Pit, the event was modelled on a 1960’s variety show and includes songs, stories, bad jokes and some really interesting stuff.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 11
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Kenton from Nundawading who just loves life and the state of Victoria; a woman who has four deeply meaningful Rings; Nairee and Michelle from Traralgon tell us about ‘my dog Oscar’; and Adrian from Brunswick has a passion for Melbourne’s live music scene.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 10
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Michael who shares his love of imagination; Ivan and Luke really like Dinosaurs; Madelaine from Clayton is a BIG fan of Horses; and Michelle from Frankston’s favourite thing is absolutely the beach.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 9
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Maya and her fairy costume; Jennifer from Regent talks about Bernadette and Lucinda; Kieran from St Kilda loves football; Kay has a favourite hat and scarf; and Monica from Avondale Heights talks about Meditation.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 8
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Madelaine talking about her love of clothes; Emma from Fitzroy’s favourite thing is sleeping; Sarah, Melanie and Hayley from Cranbourne really dig Lord Of The Rings (and friendship); and Jack from Surrey Hills talks about his Yu Gi Oh Model Kit.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 7
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Jenny from Tasmania talking about her favourite place - Melbourne - and the warm coat she wears when she visits; Ripponlea cherishes her memories; Casey from Hastings just loves hockey; Lucy and Chloe are favourite friends; and Clemet talks about Victoria and Melbourne City.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 6
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Alan from Balwyn North talking about the Collingwood footy team; John from Port Melbourne chats about his cherished remote control; Susy of Beaumaris and Victoria from Elwood both have a passion for writing; Camile of Warburton just loves going to the beach; Jack loves the outdoors, skiing and building snowmen; Fiona from St Kilda has a favourite hat; Matthew and Michael favour trains and soccer; and Rosemary’s favourite things are her five children.
